page.title: 04COLEMANS FARM.
page.content: There are 106 acres on the farm.It is a dairy farm with Friesian cows.It has three tractors- a Dexter, a Fiat and an International.Milking is done twice a day and every day the milk tanker calls to collect it.After the cattle sheds are cleared out the muck-spreader takes the muck and spreads it on the fields.The crops are forage peas, forage rape and grass for silage.A silage wagon picks up the grass and pushes it off with chains then the buck rake picks it up.There is a slurry tanker which sucks up the slurry and pumps it on to the fields.When the corn is cut the baler comes and picks up the loose straw and it comes out of the back in bales then the Loader puts the bales on the trailer.
